definitions.definition: a long, narrow opening, into which you put or fit something

examples.text: to put some coins in the slot
He slid a coin into the slot of the jukebox.
The electricity was on a slot meter.

definitions.definition: a position, a time or an opportunity for somebody/something, for example in a list, a programme of events or a series of broadcasts

examples.text: He has a regular slot on the late-night programme.
Their album has occupied the Number One slot for the past six weeks.
the airport’s take-off and landing slots
They have a prime time slot on national radio.
We need something to fill a thirty-minute slot in the late evening.

wordOrigin: late Middle English (in the sense ‘slight depression running down the middle of the chest’, surviving as a Scots term): from Old French esclot, of obscure origin.
